page.title: 11WORTH ABBEY FARM
page.content: Worth Abbey owns{500}acres of land some of which is let out to a dairy farmer, who owns{125 cows.}The calves are born from July to December. They keep the female calves and 1 bull. The mown grass is kept under a polythene sheet covered with tyres and left to make{silage,}is used to feed the cows in the winter.In the summer they leave the cows out all the time. Two people manage the whole farm. When the calves are born the vet has to come round to help them. They have about{30 different pieces of farm machinery. They grow crops which are{wheat, oats, {barley, potatoes.}50% of the crops go to feed the cows. They also get{4500 litres of milk a year. Until 1984 fresh unpasteurised milk was sold straight to the school. However due to illness in the school, the school was told to use pasteurised milk.
